title: Trump Calls Somalis ‘Garbage’ He Doesn’t Want in the Country
summary: President Trump has a history of insulting people from African countries, but the outburst was shocking in its unapologetic bigotry. Vice President JD Vance banged the table in encouragement.

title: Federal Judge Bars Some Warrantless Immigration Arrests in D.C.
summary: The judge found that immigration agents were likely acting illegally when making arrests without a warrant.

title: U.S. Pauses Immigration Applications From Nations on Travel Ban List
summary: The pause, which will halt green card and U.S. citizenship processing for broad swaths of people, deepens a remarkable crackdown on legal immigration pathways in recent days.

title: Trump Appears to Fight Sleep During Cabinet Meeting
summary: President Trump began the meeting by criticizing media coverage about him showing signs of fatigue. Last month, he appeared to doze off during a meeting in the Oval Office.

title: Trump and Hegseth Comments on Boat Strike Leave Adm. Bradley Exposed
summary: Adm. Frank M. Bradley will soon face questions from lawmakers, as Republicans and Democrats express concerns about a Sept. 2 attack on a boat in the Caribbean.

title: Hegseth Says He Did Not See Survivors of Boat Strike Clinging to Wreckage
summary: The defense secretary supported the admiral he said called for the second strike on Sept. 2 against a boat the administration says was smuggling drugs.

title: Maduro Faces His Ultimate Fight as Trump Threatens Military Action in Venezuela
summary: President Trump’s threat of military action has confronted President Nicolás Maduro of Venezuela with the gravest challenge of his crisis-ridden reign.

title: Venezuela Accepts Migrant Repatriation Flight From U.S. Amid Airspace Tensions
summary: The flight’s approval illustrates how the United States and Venezuela are still communicating, after a declaration from President Trump that Venezuelan airspace was “closed in its entirety.”

title: Matt Van Epps Wins Tennessee House Race After a Trump-Led Rescue Mission
summary: Matt Van Epps fended off a Democrat to protect Republicans’ slim House majority, but the relatively close margin in a red district sent the party a warning shot before the 2026 midterms.

title: Heading Toward Midterms, the G.O.P. Continues to Slip
summary: Almost every election night this year has gone poorly for the Republicans — a familiar position for the party that occupies the White House.

title: James Solomon Wins Jersey City Mayoral Runoff Election, Beating Jim McGreevey
summary: Mr. Solomon was elected mayor over Mr. McGreevey, who was hoping for a comeback after resigning in 2004 as New Jersey’s governor amid a sex scandal.

title: Ayanna Pressley Won’t Challenge Markey for Senate in Massachusetts
summary: Ms. Pressley, a prominent progressive, will instead run for re-election to the House. Her move is expected to help Senator Ed Markey, though he still faces one well-known Democratic primary challenger.

title: Juan Orlando Hernández, Former President of Honduras, Is Freed From Prison After Trump Pardon
summary: Juan Orlando Hernández was convicted of flooding the United States with cocaine and had been sentenced to 45 years in prison.

title: Immigration Officials Target Afghans for Deportation in Wake of D.C. Shooting
summary: The stepped-up enforcement comes as the Trump administration has also moved to reassess the vetting of Afghans who came to the country under the Biden administration.

title: Trump Calls Affordability a ‘Con Job’ as His Edge on the Economy Slips
summary: President Trump is growing frustrated as Americans struggle with higher prices and pessimism over the state of the economy.

title: ‘The President Has the Final Word’ on Pardons, U.S. Attorney Says
summary: Jay Clayton, Manhattan’s top federal prosecutor, had called his office’s drug prosecution of an ex-president of Honduras a success. President Trump decided to free him this week.

title: The 10 Best Books of 2025
summary: The staff of The New York Times Book Review choose the year’s top fiction and nonfiction.

title: Putin and Witkoff Meet in Russia as U.S. Pushes Ukraine Deal
summary: The two sides did not reach any specific compromises, an aide to President Vladimir V. Putin said, as the United States pushes a plan to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Elon Musk’s Foundation Grows to $14 Billion, but Gives Little to Outsiders
summary: The philanthropy has become one of America’s biggest, but most of its giving went to charities closely tied to the world’s richest man.

title: Cancer-Detecting Blood Tests Are on the Rise. Do They Work?
summary: The tests have not been approved by federal regulators, but that hasn’t stopped patients from wanting them — and doctors from worrying.

title: University of Oklahoma Instructor on Leave After Failing Student’s Gender Essay
summary: The essay, written for a psychology class by a University of Oklahoma student, called the idea of multiple genders “demonic.” The instructor said it did not answer the assignment.

title: U. of Alabama Suspends Black and Female Student Magazines, Citing D.E.I. Guidance
summary: Officials told staff members at two student-run publications, called Nineteen Fifty-Six and Alice, that they were not compliant with Attorney General Pam Bondi’s memo on diversity programs.

title: Eugene Hasenfus, Gunrunner Who Exposed Iran-Contra Plot, Dies at 84
summary: He emerged out of obscurity when his cargo plane was shot down while illegally ferrying arms to Nicaraguan rebels, setting off a scandal that tarnished the Reagan and Bush White Houses.

title: A Question Circling Sydney’s Beaches: Do We Still Need Shark Nets?
summary: Critics say the nets harm marine life and aren’t the best way to keep swimmers safe. Recent shark attacks have complicated a plan to remove some of them.

title: Centrists Have a Historic Mission, and They’re Blowing It
summary: Centrist governments are failing badly in Europe’s leading economies, setting the stage for a far-right sweep.

title: Giving In to Putin Would Give Up More Than Ukraine
summary: Don’t let Trump sell out its freedom for business deals with Putin.

title: ‘I Knew It Was Him’: Officer Recalls Confronting Mangione at McDonald’s
summary: A Pennsylvania patrolman said a superior had offered him a hoagie if he responded to a call at a local McDonald’s. The officer recognized the suspect and then played for time.

title: Prosecutors Drop Murder Case Against Man Who Served More Than 25 Years
summary: James Pugh, one of two men originally convicted in the savage killing of Deborah Meindl near Buffalo in 1993, said all along that he was innocent.

title: San Francisco Sues Ultraprocessed Food Companies
summary: The city attorney accuses large manufacturers of causing diseases that have burdened governments with public health costs.
